http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif GEO-CARBONATITES List GEO-CARBONATITES List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=GEO-CARBONATITES&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=GEO-CARBONATITES.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T21:13:37Z Peter Bowden 2015-03-10T22:03:29+01:00 2015-03-10T22:03:29+01:00 Goldschmidt Prague August 16 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 21 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;2212f24f.1503 Dear all,<br><br>*Generation, differentiation, ascent and emplacement of plutonic and<br>volcanic systems Theme 16e Goldschmidt Prague August 16-21*<br><br>*Theme 16e consists of several subsessions one of which convened by Melani<br>Barboni and Peter Bowden is of special interest to researchers on Silicic<br>magmas, Alkaline rocks and Carbonatites. *<br><br>Theme 16e will investigate, during several sub-sessions, the processes by<br>which magma systems are generated in the mantle (or crust), and how they<br>differentiate, assimilate, and hybridize in crustal magma chambers, then<br>ascend to shallower levels where they form plutonic complexes and produce<br>volcanic rocks. Specific areas of inquiry could include: 1) [...] Lyd\ufffd\ufffdric France 2015-02-04T09:56:28+00:00 2015-02-04T09:56:28+00:00 session "REE, carbonatites and alkaline rocks" at the SGA Biennial Meeting "Mineral Resources in a Sustainable World" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;552c2433.1502 Dear Colleagues,\ufffd\ufffdThe forthcoming 13th SGA Biennial Meeting "Mineral Resources in aSustainable World" will be organized in Nancy, France, from 24 to 27August 2015<br>http://sga2015.blog.univ-lorraine.fr/\ufffd\ufffdDuring this meeting there will be a session entitled "REE and other mineralization associated with carbonatites and alkaline rocks":<br><br>Session 7. REE and other mineralization associated to carbonatites and alkaline rocks [...] Dr S.A. Gibson 2015-01-02T10:55:42+00:00 2015-01-02T10:55:42+00:00 EGU Vienna 2015_Magmas from the Mantle_Call for Abstracts 7th Jan deadline. Gibson_Arndt_Turner https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;dccf6163.1501 Dear All<br><br>We are convening a session entitled 'Magmas from the Mantle' at EGU in<br>Vienna (12 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 17 April 2015). This focuses on the physio-chemical<br>controls involved in generation of melt from the mantle, including<br>mid-ocean ridges, intraplate and subduction settings. Questions to be<br>discussed include: whether primary melts form in the convecting and/or<br>lithospheric mantle; the temperature and composition of melt source<br>regions; volatile contents; the role of upwelling mantle plumes and/or<br>lithospheric mantle and the overlying crust as a source or control on<br>the nature of surface magmatism. Contributions from the fields of<br>geochemistry, petrology, volcanology, geophysics [...] Silvio Ferrero 2014-09-24T16:49:47+02:00 2014-09-24T16:49:47+02:00 Raman spectra of Ca-rich/carbonatitic glasses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;744c5e5d.1409 Dear all,<br>there is anybody out there who could help me to find a nice Raman spectrum<br>of Ca-rich glass, possibly a (Ca-rich) carbonatitic glass?<br>So far I just found the spectrum of a MgCO3-K2C03 glass and a<br>La(OH)3-Ca(OH)2-CaCO3-CaF2-BaSO4 glass from Genge et al. (1995).<br>Any help would be extremely appreciated.<br>Regards<br><br>Silvio Ferrero<br>tel. 0049(0)3319775705<br>Universit\ufffd\ufffdt Potsdam<br>Institut f\ufffd\ufffdr Erd- und Umweltwissenschaften<br>- Dept. of Earth and Environmental Sciences -<br>Haus 27, Karl-Liebknecht-Stra\ufffd\ufffde 24-25<br>14476 Potsdam Wall, Frances 2014-09-24T07:16:50+00:00 2014-09-24T07:16:50+00:00 FW: Fenitization https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;daef1c1c.1409 Dear geo-carbonatites members, Please see below - a question you might be able to help with from Allan Treiman. best wishes, Frances Frances Wall Camborne School of Mines University of Exeter Tel +44 (0)1326 37 1831 Email f.wall@exeter.ac.uk http://emps.exeter.ac.uk/csm/staff/fw223 ________________________________________ From: msa-talk-bounces@minlists.org [msa-talk-bounces@minlists.org] on behalf of Treiman, Allan [treiman@lpi.usra.edu] Sent: 23 September 2014 22:25 To: msa-talk@minlists.org Subject: [MSA-talk] Fenitization Hi, all - Can you recommend any recent papers about fenitization \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd fluid chemistry and such? It’s been nearly 30 years since I thought about fenites, and I’d appreciate your thoughts on which papers are the most important and useful. Thanks [...] <> 2014-09-12T15:50:51-04:00 2014-09-12T15:50:51-04:00 Re: shallow level F-Ba-LREE 'carbonatites' in italy....any information?? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;fcd095da.1409 Dear Francesco,<br><br>What a greaqt pleasure to hear from you. It has been some years<br>since I have seen you.<br><br>You have a fascinating occurrence that you have described. I am<br>afraid that I can not help with any relevant references but I would<br>certainly agree with you that it sounds very 'carbonatitic'. All that<br>fluorine can do wonders. [...] Francesco Stoppa 2014-09-12T09:13:43+02:00 2014-09-12T09:13:43+02:00 shallow level F-Ba-LREE 'carbonatites' in italy....any information?? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;66b1a335.1409 HELP.<br><br>None of you are aware of mineralized deposits similar to those of which<br>I enclose a description? If so, can you give me some references? any<br>other form of cooperation is welcome!<br><br>I have some concerns and I ask you your opinion.<br><br>thanks<br><br>Francesco<br><br>The outcrops are composed of layers with different grain size and<br>composition; from very fine grained (collophanic <40microns) particles<br>to a few mm particles. The rocks have as essential components calcite,<br>fluorite, barite, apatite, silica, selenite, anglesite, cuspidine,<br>hellandite, wilkeite and other rare minerals. Calcite forms flat<br>euhedral crystals with hexagonal contour that may refers [...] Wall, Frances 2014-08-21T21:47:57+00:00 2014-08-21T21:47:57+00:00 FW: Rare Earth Elements issue - free issue on GeoScienceWorld https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;9405612d.1408 Please see message below from Elements in case you would like to download a free copy of the Rare Earth Elements issue.<br>Best wishes,<br>Frances<br><br>Professor Frances Wall<br>Camborne School of Mines, University of Exeter<br>Penryn Campus,Penryn, Cornwall, TR10 9EZ<br>f.wall@exeter.ac.uk<mailto:f.wall@exeter.ac.uk> +44 (0)1326 37 1831<br>http://emps.exeter.ac.uk/csm/staff/fw223<br><br>From: Tremblay Pierrette [mailto:Pierrette.Tremblay@ete.inrs.ca]<br>Sent: 21 August 2014 13:50<br>Subject: Rare Earth Elements issue - free issue on GeoScienceWorld [...] Nurdane Ilbeyli 2014-06-23T00:50:41-07:00 2014-06-23T00:50:41-07:00 International Conference on Ore Potential of Alkaline, Kimberlite and Carbonatite Magmatism https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-CARBONATITES;ac5e1cc3.1406 Dear Colleagues, We are pleased to invite you to participate in the\ufffd\ufffd30th International Conference on Ore Potential of Alkaline, Kimberlite and Carbonatite Magmatism\ufffd\ufffdthat will be held in\ufffd\ufffdAntalya (TURKEY)\ufffd\ufffdfrom\ufffd\ufffd29 September - 2 October 2014.\ufffd\ufffd The conference will take place at\ufffd\ufffdthe Harrington Park Resort Hotel\ufffd\ufffd(www.harringtonparkresort.com), Antalya, Turkey. For booking of your accommodation, please kindly visit the conference website for the best prices(www.alkaline2014.com). Online registration and abstract submission are still open until 30/06/2014. Please visit the conference website\ufffd\ufffdhttp://www.alkaline2014.com\ufffd\ufffdfor updates, important deadlines and abstract submission. For this conference, topics\ufffd\ufffdinclude genesis of alkaline magmatism; genesis of kimberlites and ultrapotassic rocks; experimental data for petrogenesis of [...]
